meanings.sent1: The botanist studied the different phyllos of the plant.
meanings.sent2: The tree's phyllos rustled in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The phyllos on the ground made a crunchy sound when stepped on.

meanings.definition: A prefix meaning "related to or resembling leaves"
meanings.sent1: The herbal tea had a phyllos-like aroma.
meanings.sent2: The lizard's skin had a phyllos pattern that helped it blend in with the leaves.
meanings.sent3: The phyllos-inspired wallpaper brought a touch of nature into the room.
meanings.sent4: Her phyllos-colored scarf added a natural touch to her outfit.
meanings.sent5: The phyllos-shaped earrings dangled elegantly from her ears.

meanings.definition: A suffix meaning "having a specified number or arrangement of leaves"
meanings.sent1: The plant had a tricyclic phyllos arrangement.
meanings.sent2: The textbook explained the different phyllos configurations in plants.
meanings.sent3: The phyllos count on the tree surprised the horticulturist.
meanings.sent4: The phyllos structure of the shrub was intricate and beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The garden displayed a variety of phyllos formations, creating a stunning landscape.
